channel.title: epoll on SoByte
channel.description: Recent content in epoll on SoByte

item.title: How epoll works efficiently
item.description: Concepts epoll is an I/O event notification mechanism, which is an implementation of IO multiplexing in the linux kernel. IO multiplexing means listening to multiple input and output sources at the same time in a single operation, returning when one or more of them are available, and then performing read and write operations on them. I/O The input/output objects can be files, sockets, and pipes between processes. In linux systems,
